intro: Kalanchoe cassiopeja, commonly known as the rock garden kalanchoe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, thick leaves that are often green with a slight powdery coating. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Kalanchoe cassiopeja is popular in rock gardens and as a container plant due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
